meanings.definition: A substance that helps prevent the development of cancer.
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in anticarcinogens like fruits and vegetables can lower the risk of cancer.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommend including anticarcinogens in your diet to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: The anticarcinogen in the salad was like a shield protecting against cancer invaders.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as an anticarcinogen, fighting off any negative thoughts like cancer cells.
meanings.sent5: Imagine anticarcinogens as tiny superheroes battling cancer villains in your body.

meanings.definition: Acting to inhibit or counteract the formation of cancer cells.
meanings.sent1: The anticarcinogen properties of green tea make it a popular choice for health-conscious individuals.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying new anticarcinogen treatments to improve cancer outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The anticarcinogen effect of the medicine was so strong that it seemed to scare the cancer cells away.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an anticarcinogen power, brightening the room like a shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The anticarcinogen action of the sunscreen protected her skin from harmful UV rays like a guardian angel.
